_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Buckingham Branch Railroad - Buckingham Yard complies with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) #58 (2011 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is this facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws/codes. If an emergency were to occur, it is the facility's policy to notify the Buckingham County Fire Department as well as the Buckingham County Emergency Services, as necessary.  Medical emergencies will require notification of Buckingham County Rescue and Southside Community Hospital. This facility has an Emergency Action Plan; however, does not maintain a trained fire brigade or hazardous material response team on-site to respond to the small initial stages of an emergency.



The Buckingham Branch Railroad - Buckingham Yard is a butane transloading facility (specifically, railcar to truck tanker). This Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the butane transloading system only, including the associated piping and fourteen (14) storage tanks (detached railcars) and additional railcar storage (up to thirty-one [31]) railcars off-site (solite) on a contiguous line. 



The Buckingham Branch Railroad - Buckingham Yard complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) accident prevention rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) Standard (29 CFR Part 1910.119), the OSHA Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response (HAZWOPER) Standard (29 CFR Part 1910.120), and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. This butane transloading system is designed, constructed and maintained in accordance with NFPA #58 and the manufacturer's (Texon, L.P.) instructions. Railcars meet the U.S. Department of Transportation Federal Railroad Administration design requirements for pressurized tank cars.



This is a new facility; therefore, it has never had an accident involving butane which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property

/environmental damage, evacuation or shelterings in-place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Buckingham Branch Railroad - Buckingham Yard butane transloading system, it is the policy of the facility to initially contact the Buckingham County Fire Department and request their assistance. The facility personnel are trained.  The facility emergency action plans are coordinated with the fire departments and Buckingham County Emergency Services.  The Buckingham County Fire Department is aware of the system and its available fire protection systems (site fire extinguishers and emergency shut-off devices). The primary hazardous materials response capabilities are provided by the Buckingham County Emergency Services.



Improvement actions to be considered primarily focus on site security and rail safety measures including continuing safety audits and safety inspections.
